title: IMAGIC-500: IMputation benchmark on A Generative Imaginary Country (500k samples)
summary: This paper introduces IMAGIC-500, a synthetic dataset derived from a World Bank household survey, to benchmark missing data imputation methods in socioeconomic research. It evaluates imputation accuracy and impact on downstream predictive tasks under various missing mechanisms and ratios.
usefulness_reason: Score 80 assigned because the paper focuses on missing data imputation in "socioeconomic datasets" and utilizes a "World Bank household survey," directly addressing "Contextual dataset" and "Survey data" keywords. It does not, however, focus on spatio-temporal point processes.
